title: Out For BLOOD
body_text:
WOLF vs. JUAN III Results
Battered, Bruised, and Bloodied!
One "punted" all doubters high and far. The other launched dangerously poisonous "muffins" at every target. This was the culmination of a five month-long issue waiting to be resolved ..
Justin WOLF
against
JUAN Londono
, Round III!
And of course the sadistic
GodMode Rules
stipulation just had to be added to the mix in order to get the full effect of the brutalization this Rivalry-of-the-Year contender has produced.
Flash Results by Game
:
WOLF: 1, 3
JUAN: 2, 4, 5, 6
The chilly, fall temperature quickly shot up a few degrees on this particular Saturday night. Blistering heat from the endless barrage of atomic weapons as well as the hatred-filled competitors put Global Warming to shame. The captains especially were not shy or hesitant in their approach to the frontlines, leaving welts the size of craters on each of their ravaged bodies.
The encounter as a whole was a close as it gets, with each squad splitting the first four rounds right down the middle. But the sneaky "Cockroach" managed to pull ahead in the late-night hours and thus, had defeated his greatest adversary maybe for the last time.
EastCoastDodgeball
applauds the endless efforts put forth by both of these mainstream competitors. Justin Wolf and Juan Londono gave everything in their bodies and hearts, delivering in high fashion for all those that witnessed throughout their lengthy program. And though the "Muffin Man" picked up the monumental victory, both embark on separate paths as true champions of the game.
JUAN 4, WOLF 2
.
The Rules
: Classic two-team match-up.
The Match
: Juan Londono defeated Justin Wolf, 4 - 2, in a feud-ending
GodMode Rules
contest. *The prematch stipulation stated that if Wolf was victorious, there would be one final encounter between the two rivals.
Captains Statistics
: Juan 7-2-2 / Wolf 1-3-1. With this victory, Juan Londono reached the second most number of total wins only behind Kevin Adams. Justin Wolf has yet to compete in anything other than a singles contest.
Moments & Stars
: Steve Kass unintentionally stopping mid-air bulletballs; Ryan McCrorey pelted three times in Game 2
Attendance
: 23, comprised of 19 men and 4 women
Other Notes
: This was the first event since DODGEBALL CXLIV in late-June that did not feature a single new participant. This was also the second
GodMode Rules
match in Season 16, the first of these between Ryan Letsche and Grant Cornero at
DODGEBALL 151
.
WOLF vs. JUAN History
DODGEBALL CXL:
Family Affair
..
DODGEBALL 142
________________________________________
_______
DODGEBALL 159: October 11
The final stop on
The Road to CLX
and the "chase" is on!
DODGEBALL CLX: October 18 beginning at 6pm
Feel
the power
and electricity of the magnificent Season 16 Finale! In the main event, a "Dream Match" never thought possible when arguably the two most destructive female entities to ever compete epically collide one-on-one!
Kerrin Marchese
versus
Melissa Kerr
!
In the secondary attraction, a special
Battle Royal
has been scheduled on this super Saturday night! Bragging rights are on the line so best come physically and mentally prepared!
The ten event classics will be on hand as well .. a kick-ass soundtrack, colorful decorations, family and friends! What a way to close out this 16th Season of
EastCoastDodgeball
!
body_html:
WOLF vs. JUAN III Results
Battered, Bruised, and Bloodied!

One "punted" all doubters high and far. The other launched dangerously poisonous "muffins" at every target. This was the culmination of a five month-long issue waiting to be resolved .. Justin WOLF against JUAN Londono, Round III!

And of course the sadistic GodMode Rules stipulation just had to be added to the mix in order to get the full effect of the brutalization this Rivalry-of-the-Year contender has produced.

Flash Results by Game:
WOLF: 1, 3
JUAN: 2, 4, 5, 6

The chilly, fall temperature quickly shot up a few degrees on this particular Saturday night. Blistering heat from the endless barrage of atomic weapons as well as the hatred-filled competitors put Global Warming to shame. The captains especially were not shy or hesitant in their approach to the frontlines, leaving welts the size of craters on each of their ravaged bodies.

The encounter as a whole was a close as it gets, with each squad splitting the first four rounds right down the middle. But the sneaky "Cockroach" managed to pull ahead in the late-night hours and thus, had defeated his greatest adversary maybe for the last time.

EastCoastDodgeball applauds the endless efforts put forth by both of these mainstream competitors. Justin Wolf and Juan Londono gave everything in their bodies and hearts, delivering in high fashion for all those that witnessed throughout their lengthy program. And though the "Muffin Man" picked up the monumental victory, both embark on separate paths as true champions of the game.

JUAN 4, WOLF 2.

The Rules: Classic two-team match-up.
The Match: Juan Londono defeated Justin Wolf, 4 - 2, in a feud-ending GodMode Rules contest. *The prematch stipulation stated that if Wolf was victorious, there would be one final encounter between the two rivals.
Captains Statistics: Juan 7-2-2 / Wolf 1-3-1. With this victory, Juan Londono reached the second most number of total wins only behind Kevin Adams. Justin Wolf has yet to compete in anything other than a singles contest.
Moments & Stars: Steve Kass unintentionally stopping mid-air bulletballs; Ryan McCrorey pelted three times in Game 2
Attendance: 23, comprised of 19 men and 4 women
Other Notes: This was the first event since DODGEBALL CXLIV in late-June that did not feature a single new participant. This was also the second GodMode Rules match in Season 16, the first of these between Ryan Letsche and Grant Cornero at DODGEBALL 151.

WOLF vs. JUAN History
DODGEBALL CXL: Family Affair .. DODGEBALL 142

_______________________________________________


DODGEBALL 159: October 11
The final stop on The Road to CLX and the "chase" is on!

DODGEBALL CLX: October 18 beginning at 6pm
Feel the power and electricity of the magnificent Season 16 Finale! In the main event, a "Dream Match" never thought possible when arguably the two most destructive female entities to ever compete epically collide one-on-one! Kerrin Marchese versus Melissa Kerr!

In the secondary attraction, a special Battle Royal has been scheduled on this super Saturday night! Bragging rights are on the line so best come physically and mentally prepared!

The ten event classics will be on hand as well .. a kick-ass soundtrack, colorful decorations, family and friends! What a way to close out this 16th Season of EastCoastDodgeball!
